topic.title: Swap rebalance online upgrade
topic.shortdesc: Online upgrade with the swap rebalance is the preferred upgrade method because it always maintains the cluster capacity throughout the upgrade.

body.p: You can perform a swap rebalance to upgrade your Couchbase Server nodes without reducing your cluster performance due to diminished capacity from missing nodes. You need at least one extra node to perform a swap rebalance. If you are unable to perform an upgrade using the swap rebalance, perform a standard online upgrade instead.
Ideally, you will need at least one extra node to perform a swap rebalance.
body.section:
Without an extra node availableIf you have enough cluster capacity to service requests after removing one of the nodes, first remove an existing node to serve as the initial swap node:
Back up the entire cluster.
Remove one node from the cluster by selecting Manage Server Nodes Remove Server for the node you wish to remove.
Click Rebalance.

section.title: With an extra node available
section.p: If you have an extra node available for the rebalance:

ol.li: Install the latest version of Couchbase Server on the extra node that is not yet a part of the cluster. For instructions see .
Create a backup of your cluster data using the cbbackup tool.
Open the Couchbase Web Console on an existing cluster node.
Select Servers Active Servers to view and manage the cluster nodes:

In the Add Server dialog, provide either a hostname or IP address for the new node to be added. Enter your Couchbase Server administrative credentials in the fields Username and Password and select the appropriate service.

Remove one of your existing old nodes from the cluster.
Under Server Nodes Server panel , click Remove Server for the node you want to remove to mark the node for removal.
In the Servers panel, click Rebalance. The rebalance process moves data from the existing node to your newly added node.

section.p: Repeat these steps for all the remaining old nodes in the cluster. You can add and remove multiple nodes from a cluster. However, always add the same number of nodes from the cluster as you remove.
For example, staging the addition of 4 nodes and the removal of 4 nodes will work fine, but the addition of 7 nodes and removal of 4 nodes does not work.
